subject: Communication
title: Time Orientation: Clock vs. Event
description: Learn Time Orientation: Clock vs. Event in one minute.

hook.text: In Switzerland, arriving 2 minutes late is rude. In Nigeria, 'the meeting starts when the right people arrive.

buildup.text: Hall distinguished monochronic time (linear, scheduled, sequential) from polychronic time (flexible, relationship-driven).

discovery.text: Monochronic cultures (US, Germany, Japan) see time as a resource to spend.

twist.text: Neither orientation is more productive. Monochronic cultures waste time in unnecessary meetings.

climax.text: The deepest time conflicts arise in mixed teams: one side feels disrespected by lateness; the other feels rushed by.

punchline.text: Time isn't universal. It's cultural. And clashing about it is timeless.
